question:
Which of the following difference(s) is/are correct, with respect to eukaryotic and prokaryotic cell?
  1. While nucleus is absent in case of eukaryotic cell, it is present in prokaryotic cell
  2. While Ribosome is absent in case of eukaryotic cell, it is present in prokaryotic cell
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation:
First statement is incorrect because nucleus is absent in case of prokaryotic cell and present in eukaryotic cell.
Second statement is incorrect because Ribosomes are present in both eukaryotic and prokaryotic cell.
Kindly note that organelles such as Lysosomes, Peroxisomes, Mitochondria and endoplasmic reticulum are present in case of eukaryotic cells whereas they are absent in case of prokaryotic cell.
